meanings.definition: A substance used as fuel in a rocket engine that decomposes spontaneously to produce thrust.
meanings.sent1: The monopropellant ignited, propelling the rocket into space.
meanings.sent2: The engineers loaded the monopropellant into the rocket before launch.
meanings.sent3: The monopropellant decided to blast off on its own rocket adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a monopropellant, driving her towards her goals with unstoppable force.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange glow of the monopropellant lit up the night sky as the rocket soared.

meanings.definition: A type of propellant that does not require an oxidizer to combust.
meanings.sent1: The monopropellant was efficient in powering the rocket without needing an oxidizer.
meanings.sent2: The monopropellant was carefully stored in the fuel tanks of the spacecraft.
meanings.sent3: The monopropellant threw a party for all the other propellants that needed oxidizers.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the monopropellant symbolized independence and self-sufficiency.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the monopropellant's design made it a favorite among rocket scientists.
